content: How can I help you today?
Well, I’ve been struggling to sleep at night lately because I can’t stop worrying about work. There’s just so much on my mind, and it feels overwhelming.

That sounds really challenging, feeling overwhelmed and stuck in a cycle of worry when you're trying to rest. Sleep is so important, and it must be frustrating for those work concerns to keep getting in the way of it. What do you think has been weighing on you the most lately?

I’m just really worried about losing my job. There's been talk about layoffs, and I feel like I could be one of the first to go. With the stock market the way it is, I don't know how I'd provide for my family if that happens. It’s constantly on my mind.

It must be such a heavy weight, constantly living with that fear and uncertainty about your job and your family's future. It’s understandable that it’s been hard to turn off those thoughts when everything feels so out of your control. How have you been coping with these worries so far?

Well, honestly, I’ve been using my phone a lot at night to distract myself. I know it’s not helping because it just feeds more thoughts into my head, but it feels impossible to calm down without it. I’m kind of stuck in this loop, and I don’t know what else to do.

It sounds like you’re doing your best to manage the stress in those moments, even though you can see how the cycle might be affecting you in other ways. Being stuck like that can feel frustrating and exhausting. What do you think makes it so hard to step out of that loop?

I guess it’s just that when I put my phone down, my mind immediately goes back to all those worries—about work, money, and my family. At least with my phone, I can distract myself for a while, even if it doesn’t fix anything. I just don’t know how to deal with all these thoughts when they won’t stop.

It sounds like those worries are so persistent that they feel overwhelming and hard to manage without some kind of distraction. You're doing what you can to protect yourself from that constant flood of stress, even though it’s not always giving you the relief you need. What would it mean to you if you could find a way to quiet those racing thoughts and feel a little more at ease?

I think it would mean everything to me. It would help me feel more in control and maybe even give me the energy to deal with everything better. I just don’t really know where to start or how to make that happen.

Having more control and peace sounds so important to you, especially with everything going on. Even though you're not sure where to begin, it says a lot about you that you're thinking about taking steps forward. What do you think might make it easier to start exploring ways to feel more relaxed or in control?

I’m not really sure. Maybe if I had something small to try that wouldn’t feel too overwhelming, I could give it a shot. It’s hard to picture adding more to my plate right now, but I know I need to do something.

It makes sense to want something manageable that doesn’t add to the weight you’re already carrying. Even small steps can make a difference when you’re ready to try them. Is there anything else you’d like to explore or talk about before we think about what could work for you?
I think that’s everything for now. Thank you for talking this through with me. It’s been helpful to get it off my chest, and I’ll think about those little steps I could try.
